page.title: 01General Review, Whitby.
page.content: This popular tourist area is situated on the North East Coast of{North {Yorkshire.}The town and port of Whitby has a population of 13,750 and lies on the{River Esk,}which divides Whitby into two sections and runs into the{ {North Sea.}The popular fishing town with its quaint streets and long sandy beach is famous for its connections with{Captain James Cook,}the great explorer and navigator. The ancient ruined{Abbey,}hallowed since 657 A.D. and the interestingly constructed{Parish Church of St. {Mary's}nearby, attract thousands of visitors every year. Many climb the notorious 199 steps to enjoy panoramic views of the hinterland of wild moorland within the{North Yorks Moors {National Park.}The visitors bring much needed trade and revenue to the area which has a high unemployment level.
